requirement_summary: Conditions for re-use of categories of protected data
description: Documented procedure for managing re-use requests for categories of protected data held by public sector bodies, including conditions for access, anonymisation, secure processing environments, and non-disclosure agreements
auditor_questions: How do you handle requests for re-use of protected public sector data?
What technical measures ensure data protection during re-use (anonymisation, aggregation, secure environments)?
Show me your process for assessing and granting re-use requests
How do you prevent re-identification of anonymised data?

maturity_levels.basic: Basic procedure exists for processing re-use requests
maturity_levels.intermediate: Secure processing environments available, anonymisation techniques applied, NDA templates in place
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated re-use request processing, privacy-preserving computation, continuous re-identification risk monitoring

description: Documentation of the competent body designation and its role in assisting re-users, including information on available datasets, conditions for re-use, and technical support for accessing data
auditor_questions: Who is the designated competent body for assisting data re-users?
How do you provide information about available datasets and re-use conditions?
What technical support is available to help re-users access data?
How do you ensure interoperability of metadata across competent bodies?

maturity_levels.basic: Competent body designated, basic information available to re-users
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured dataset catalogue, clear conditions documentation, helpdesk support
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated discovery portal, machine-readable conditions, API-based dataset access

requirement_summary: Requirements for data intermediation services providers
description: Policy documenting how the data intermediation services provider ensures neutrality, separates data intermediation from other services, and prevents conflicts of interest in data exchange facilitation
auditor_questions: How do you ensure neutrality as a data intermediation services provider?
Show me evidence of structural separation between intermediation and other services
How do you prevent conflicts of interest in data exchange facilitation?
What pricing model do you use and how is it non-discriminatory?

maturity_levels.basic: Policy exists defining neutrality principles and structural separation
maturity_levels.intermediate: Formal separation documented, conflict of interest register, regular audits
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated compliance monitoring, transparent governance structure, independent oversight board

description: Copy of the notification submitted to the competent authority for providing data intermediation services, including details of the provider, type of service, and start date of activities
auditor_questions: Show me the notification submitted to the competent authority
What information was included in the notification?
How do you notify the authority of any material changes to the notified information?
Have you received confirmation or any requests for additional information from the authority?

maturity_levels.basic: Notification submitted to competent authority before starting operations
maturity_levels.intermediate: Change management process for notification updates, compliance tracking
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated notification updates, proactive regulatory engagement, cross-border notification coordination

requirement_summary: Conditions for providing data intermediation services
description: Documented procedures ensuring compliance with conditions for data intermediation including fair and non-discriminatory access, data format interoperability, logging of data exchange activities, and security measures
auditor_questions: How do you ensure fair, transparent, and non-discriminatory access to your intermediation service?
Show me your data exchange activity logs for the past quarter
What security measures protect data during intermediation?
How do you facilitate interoperability between different data formats?

maturity_levels.basic: Basic access policies, manual data exchange logging
maturity_levels.intermediate: Automated logging, format conversion capabilities, documented security controls
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time monitoring, automated compliance verification, advanced interoperability framework

requirement_summary: Cross-border access to data for re-use
description: Documentation of mechanisms supporting cross-border re-use of protected data including single information point accessibility, interoperable metadata standards, and cooperation with other Member States
auditor_questions: How do you support cross-border access to datasets for re-use?
What interoperable metadata standards do you use?
How do you cooperate with competent bodies in other Member States?
Show me evidence that cross-border re-users can access your data under equivalent conditions

maturity_levels.basic: Basic cross-border access enabled, single information point accessible online
maturity_levels.intermediate: Standardised metadata, multilingual support, defined cooperation procedures
maturity_levels.advanced: Federated data access infrastructure, automated cross-border request processing, real-time interoperability

requirement_summary: General requirements for registration of data altruism organisations
description: Registration documentation for recognised data altruism organisations including proof of non-profit status, objectives of general interest, independence from for-profit entities, and transparency requirements
auditor_questions: Show me your registration as a recognised data altruism organisation
How do you demonstrate your non-profit status and objectives of general interest?
What governance measures ensure independence from for-profit entities?
How do you maintain the register of data altruism activities?

maturity_levels.basic: Registration completed, basic governance structure in place
maturity_levels.intermediate: Published transparency report, independent governance board, activity register maintained
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time transparency dashboard, automated governance reporting, independent oversight mechanisms

requirement_summary: Public register of recognised data altruism organisations
description: Maintained register of data altruism activities including data subjects and data holders contributing data, purposes of data use, and data processing activities performed
auditor_questions: Show me your register of data altruism activities for the past year
How do you track consent given by data subjects for altruistic purposes?
What purposes has the collected data been used for?
How do you ensure transparency about data use to contributing data subjects?

maturity_levels.basic: Basic activity register maintained with manual updates
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured register with categorised activities, regular reporting to authorities
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated activity tracking, real-time consent management, public transparency portal

requirement_summary: Competent authorities for data intermediation and altruism
description: Documentation of interactions with competent authorities designated under the DGA, including notifications, compliance communications, and records of supervisory activities
auditor_questions: Who is your designated competent authority under the DGA?
Show me records of communications with the competent authority
How do you respond to supervisory requests or investigations?
What is your process for notifying the authority of compliance issues?

maturity_levels.basic: Competent authority identified, basic communication records maintained
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured regulatory engagement process, compliance calendar, proactive reporting
maturity_levels.advanced: Integrated regulatory management system, automated compliance reporting, proactive regulatory dialogue
